questions.question: What is the most important festival in China?
questions.explanation: Chinese New Year (Spring Festival) is the most important festival in China, celebrated on the first day of the first month of the lunar calendar.

questions.question: What is the traditional color of marriage in China?
questions.explanation: Red is considered the color of good luck and prosperity in China, so it is the traditional color of marriage.

questions.question: What is the most important element in Chinese cuisine?
questions.explanation: Rice is the most important element in Chinese cuisine, eaten with almost every meal.

questions.question: What is the most important animal in the Chinese zodiac?
questions.explanation: The Rat (Mouse) is the first animal in the Chinese zodiac cycle, starting the cycle.

questions.question: What is the most important element in Feng Shui?
questions.explanation: Feng Shui consists of five elements: Water, Fire, Earth, Metal, and Wood. All are important for balance.

questions.question: What is the most important philosophy in China?
questions.explanation: Confucianism, Taoism, and Buddhism are all important philosophies in China, with different influences on society.

questions.question: What is the most important element in Chinese painting?
questions.explanation: Chinese painting consists of color, line, and space, all of which are important for the whole art.

questions.question: What is the most important element in Chinese calligraphy?
questions.explanation: Chinese calligraphy requires brush, ink, and paper, all of which are important for the art.

questions.question: What is the most important element in Chinese tea ceremony?
questions.explanation: Chinese tea ceremony requires tea, teapot, and cups, all of which are important for the ceremony.

questions.question: What is the most important element in Chinese garden?
questions.explanation: Chinese garden consists of plants, water, and rocks, all of which are important for the whole garden.
